item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Ross Ulbricht granted a full pardon (1000 points | 1008 comments)
2. Stargate Project: SoftBank, OpenAI, Oracle, MGX to build data centers (634 points | 674 comments)
3. Arm releases Chiplet System Architecture spec beta version (16 points | 1 comment)
4. 0-click deanonymization attack targeting Signal, Discord, other platforms (1205 points | 383 comments)
5. Moving on from React, a year later (203 points | 111 comments)
6. Infinigen (102 points | 9 comments)
7. Hunyuan3D 2.0 – High-Resolution 3D Assets Generation (203 points | 87 comments)
8. Isolating complexity is the essence of successful abstractions (94 points | 24 comments)
9. Invisible Electrostatic Wall at 3M plant (1996) (335 points | 166 comments)
10. Icelandic turf houses: Laufas, Glaumbaer and others (16 points | 3 comments)
11. DHS removes all members of cyber security advisory boards, halts investigations (67 points | 48 comments)
12. Calm tech certification "rewards" less distracting tech (277 points | 71 comments)
13. Flame: A small language model for spreadsheet formulas (2023) (27 points | 1 comment)
14. Why is zero plural? (2024) (57 points | 96 comments)
15. What are these bumps on the top of a pull-tab can? (159 points | 14 comments)
16. Tensor Product Attention Is All You Need (60 points | 43 comments)
17. Castle Game Engine: Web target – big progress, first 3 demos to try (72 points | 12 comments)
18. Mercator: Extreme (155 points | 31 comments)
19. The first release of OpenVox, the OSS implementation of Puppet (28 points | 10 comments)
20. Masters of Allusion: The Art of Poetic Reference (3 points | 1 comment)
21. Ask HN: Is anyone doing anything cool with tiny language models? (392 points | 180 comments)
22. Open-source browser port of Pitfall from the Atari 2600 (56 points | 13 comments)
23. Dissecting "Tiny Clouds" shadertoy (2017) (41 points | discuss)
24. Life in Another Light, 2024 Infrared-Photography-Contest Winners (6 points | 2 comments)
25. JReleaser: quick and effortless way to release your project (80 points | 23 comments)
26. Prime numbers so memorable that people hunt for them (133 points | 75 comments)
27. The Peppermills of Jens Quistgaard (70 points | 40 comments)
28. HyperDX (YC S22) is hiring engineers to build open source observability ( | hide)
29. Sigstore: Making sure your software is what it claims to be (77 points | 21 comments)
30. Show HN: I made a app that uses NFC as a physical switch to block distractions (182 points | 97 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 at 9:15 AM UTC
